title: BI Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews. Interviews were with hiring manager, team and then finally director. The interviews were straight forward. The questions revolve around sql knowledge, tableau experience and Power BI experience. A few questions were asked about the software development life cycle.
Interview Questions: Please see my comments above

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in May 2023
Interview Descriptions:
20 min + video interview and then an in person. 

Asked basic questions regarding experience. 

They will claim they will let you know if you moved on to the next step but just end up just ghosting instead.

Archaic technologies are used.  They did not seem open to using anything new and stuck with what they know. Not good for growth.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with Linux commands?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty good. Easy interview. Fun and interesting. Was in a group with many people and it was great talking with many other people. We had to watch two videos and make some comments. Videos were fun.
Interview Questions: How would you rate your interview experience

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy to follow- interviewer asked many relevant questions that were applicable to the job. Found the process to be very straightforward and helpful when actually applying for the job
Interview Questions: What relevant experience do you have

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: representing. Provide an overview of the interview process and what the interviewee can expect. It is important to establish a friendly and welcoming tone to make the interviewee feel comfortable. Background: Ask the interviewee to provide some background information about themselves, such as their education, work experience, and any relevant skills or qualifications. This will help you understand their perspective and provide context for the rest of the interview. Goals and Motivations: Ask the interviewee about their goals and motivations. This can help you understand their values, aspirations, and what drives them. For example, you can ask them about their long-term career goals, what they hope to achieve in their current role, or what motivates them to excel at work
Interview Questions: Do I have a lot of time in the following semester

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: 30 min interview asked simple questions. Had a technical, verbal, and communications, interview section. People were very nice and were happy to answer any question you may have. Got my offer 2 months after my interview.
Interview Questions: Asked how to print multiple slides on 1 page.

title: Preschool Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Fill out application on Rutgers website. You will receive a Phone call and Set up interview according to your availability. Come to the location and you will Interview in the Supervisor office. The Supervisor will ask you questions and you will have to Answer questions . 30 minutes
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have? Do you have your P-3 certificate?

title: Special Education Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held in a timely manner and the administrators were personable. They offered a lot of good information about the school, students, and staff. It was overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: What type of skill acquisition programming would you focus on given a certain age range of learners.

title: Foundation Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Wasted hours on months of an extended interview process with over 16 current employees -- affiliated with the role and not -- that resulted in a form email at 10pm on a Sunday evening. Completely unprofessional and disrespectful of candidates' time.
Interview Questions: Involved 18+ hours of interviewing

title: Peer Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The employer was very nice and introduced the whole process of the work. Asked you some basic questions. Be confident and express your willing to help. Have some own strategies for helping diverse groups.
Interview Questions: What your own strategy for helping freshman to learn about more school activities.

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. You are interviewed by one of the building managers. Be sure to show up at least ten minutes in advance, be cheerful, and remain confident. It was a series of scenario based questions followed by personal questions.
Interview Questions: Question: Describe how you would tell a patron how to get to our facility from the Quads, for example. Question: Describe a difficult moment and how you have persevered. Question: What is one thing you would suggest to improve Recreation.

title: Finance PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Committee members come together and ask you some general questions. The interview starts with a self-introduction and then moves to your research background. They will ask you about the projects you have done as well as the specific research question you want to study in the future. Overall, the interview is easy, and the atmosphere is pretty good.
Interview Questions: Self-introduction; previous research project; future research field;

title: Student Programming Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Simple easy and to the point. The director was very chill. Simple role assignment. Best of the best. One of the easy roles to master for any new student. Any student can pick up easily
Interview Questions: How was your experience at rutgers and when can you start?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It was quite brief! They were very nice and straight to the point. The meeting lasted about 20 minutes and I got a call shortly after telling me that I got the job as the marketing coordinator in one of their schools.
Interview Questions: Can you write a press release?

title: Temporary Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got an email about interview and then they want me to complete 2 skills tests which are about supervisory skill and analyzing data. After complete these tests we set up an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Are you US citizen or do you have greencard?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I have two round interviews. The process was normal. Have a phone interview and video interview. I have got Average question, and average vibe. The whole process was normal not very hard
Interview Questions: Why do you choose this area

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: No interview showed me around and explained duties and procedures. Asked me if i had any prior knowledge in this field. If i had a drivers license. Very kind and chill
Interview Questions: Are you familar with research

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy. Just a few questions. Mainly about availability and what their expectations were for you on the job. They also asked about prior work experience, just to see if this was your first job or not.
Interview Questions: When are you available to work?

title: Part Time Student Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: A quick interview process online through zoom and clear description of the job and what it needed, daily tasks, etc. The paid were mentioned as well during the interview process, flexible hour were provided.
Interview Questions: How many hour could you work ?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The process was straightforward and asked standard interview questions. I applied online and was contacted for a virtual interview. I met with different team members in the organization.  It was a standard interview process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Teaching Specialist V Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is straight forward with the basic interview questions, go over publications of your PI and be inquisitive. Given opportunities if the grades are good and did a thesis
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current experiences and why you want to job this position

title: MHC II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Edison, NJ) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Long process. Simple but long. Must complete full physical with a Rutgers appointed physician before offer is official. Only one interview, on Zoom with Director and program supervisor, lasted 1hr. Lots of questions and scenarios
Interview Questions: Specific situations regarding crisis intervention, team work, and treatment modalities. They were interested in knowing history of working with groups. Group work is a MUST

title: Post Doc Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Very open and direct, the team was welcoming and exciting. As far as interview processes go, it was the shortest of the ones I experienced, and there was no need for an autobot personality test or extraneous items in the process.
Interview Questions: To describe your background and interests for future development

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: After completing an online application, they reached out via email for a Zoom interview. The questions were about availability, organizational strategies, and experience related to administrative duties. This position was for the educational department, so they also asked about background related to that.
Interview Questions: What is one strategy you use for time management and organization?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a two step process. First interview was with the Principle Investigator and the research coordinator that was leaving. It was through Zoom and fairly easy. The second interview was with HR. The asked for my CV again that detailed all the laboratory experience I had. The hiring process took over a month after I accepted the job offer.
Interview Questions: What type of laboratory experience do you have.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Formal, in person, was a good process, I got hired. Campus center associate. Decent base pay review. It went well. Formal, in person, was a good process, I got hired. Campus center associate. Decent base pay review. It went well
Interview Questions: What’s customer service mean to you

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: First contact was a phone interview. Followed by an in-person interview with hiring manager then lastly an in-person interview with the director of the department. Interviews were used to discuss my previous experience and the departments role on the campus.
Interview Questions: Expected administrative and technical questions

title: Program Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fully remote process, moved very quickly! Had an initial phone interview with the hiring manager, proceeded to make the next round- a Zoom call with a panel of 4 interviewers, then had a final phone interview with an HR representative and received an offer. All within about a week's time, but this will vary based on the department and their needs.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell me a little bit about yourself and your background.

Q: What made you want to apply for this job? 

Q: Why do you want to work at Rutgers?

Q: What are some of the strengths you possess and you could bring to this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my professor at the end of the semester to become a TA for the course, and she easily agreed (because I got an A and met with her regularly during office hours)
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA for this course and do you want to get a recommendation through your TA? What time are you available?

title: IT Deskside Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: They want people that aren't really in tech. So you probably won't get it if you are a CS engineer or something like that. The people I know that have been chosen to work there are econ or a humanities degree.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with tech

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It was cordial and collegial. They had a sense of honesty and investment that I had not experienced any where else. Additionally, there was a keen sense of professionalism, from the moment I was invited to do the interview until the very end. It was definitely exciting and I couldn’t be happier going through the process.
Interview Questions: My future projects and teaching skills

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Completed a phone screening with a manager first. Then was invited for a live interview with a panel of 3 people. Invited back for a final interview that included a skills test but declined.
Interview Questions: How do you stay current on trends in the instructional design industry?

title: Classroom Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I sat in a room with 4 people and I interviewed with all of them at once. Spoke about my experience and how I would handle situations in a classroom. Then  they went over job requirements.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student started acting up while running a program.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and to the point. Will not be tricky. Asks the basic questions you would expect. Why are you here? What are you trying to accomplish? What can you bring to the table?
Interview Questions: Why are you applying to our department?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a video call where 2 people asked questions about my knowledge on troubleshooting and computers and about what to do during certain scenarios. My interviewers were very kind and patient when I was answering their questions.
Interview Questions: Your coworker is slacking off. What do you do?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Takes long for them to contact you but once you are contact, the interview session is average. Panel interview like. Once you are offered the position, HR process not very clear.
Interview Questions: Are you able to keep up with the high demand from students?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process. Spoke with various people that explained the position in detail. What I enjoyed is that they were able to do this in a panel interview setup. That way I did not have many interviews at different times. This may have been due to COVID, but this made the interview process easier.
Interview Questions: Describe your past work experience and how it aligns with this position;

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It took quite a long time to go through the system just because of the system of appliance and getting past all of the barriers for a job and then hear back
Interview Questions: What is the most important trifecta in project management when  looking at program coordination?

title: Global Roommate Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: You can do it with your partner or alone. No matter what option you choose, they have the fixed question in a list, around 6 or 7. They are about why you want to apply for this position, how to solve roommate conflicts, etc.
Interview Questions: why you want to apply for this position, how to solve roommate conflicts, etc.

title: Associate Director of Web Strategy and Systems Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
First I was contacted via email, 
Then I had two phone screens
Afterwards  I had two video interviews
Followed by ghosting, after the final round I heard nothing for some time, which is unprofessional. 
Overall end to end was about 4 weeks from first contact to me deciding I wasn't going to get some professional courtesy. I had a decade of experience, private sector, state government, and federal experience (I was actually an executive in the federal government when we began the process, the lack of courtesy for someone who's a fellow civil servant was disappointing)
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in a nonprofit environment? Do you have editorial experience? How do you leverage marketing for initiatives?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview that I had with this company gave me a better insight on how to answer questions that are in the likes of clinical research. I think its important to gain proper knowledge prior to your interview and that is what would have made my interview a bit better
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Seamless and based on logical thinking, decision making competency. There is emphasis on continuous improvement in the role, hybrid work environment for all roles is also available. The professors are really helpful and available for guiding through the complex tasks in the project.
Interview Questions: Why do you like this role?

title: Student Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Had the interview with Mary Ann in her office at Cook Douglass. Basic review of your transcript, especially for the courses you want to tutor. Be prepared to give remarks about any low grades you may have had for other courses as well.
Interview Questions: I had a C in a single class while the rest were A's. She asked why this was the case.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I was a given a list of problems and on the day of the interview, one was selected for me to do on the board as I would in front of a real class.
Interview Questions: How/what kind of technology have you used in the classroom?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quite detailed, but no extremely challenging questions. First round with 2 members of the team.  Second round with 2 groups. Everyone was friendly and it seems to go well. But sadly they never followed up to invite back, or even thank for attending.
Interview Questions: More focused on experience and expectations for the particular role.

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions:
Worst interview of my life. Went in person and had to complete multiple whiteboard coding problems as well as one debugging code problem. They also asked me to recall every class I took in university and asked me class specific questions (wtf).

Overall the entire session was three hours (way over time). Obviously I did not do very well as what they were asking of me was beyond ridiculous - I'm a person, not a human robot able to recall all of this information! 😓 They proceeded to ghost me.
Interview Questions:
Bring in code samples and discuss what you did.
Debug code live.

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Too many interviews. Nice people. Decent pay and benefits, offer of continued education which is nice if you're into such a thing. Did I say too many interviews, though? Overall, seems like a nice place to work if you enjoy a lot of breadth in your job.
Interview Questions: Difference between an interface and an abstract class.

title: Application Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Simple phone interview, except literally over a phone call which is archaic in the year 2021-22. Interviewer didn't seem to care about any critical thinking abilities or actual skills, just rote memorization. Stay away.

Asked random trivia-esque questions, as well as if I knew what a certain acronym meant. Replied I didn't, afterwards I googled it and realized I did know what they meant as I had been using it for years. They were just calling it a nickname I had never heard of.

Not once was I asked about anything on my resume besides clarifying if I filled their laundry-list of knowledge of random technologies. 

Take the title literally, they don't want an engineer. They want a programmer who will be little more than a code monkey. Nothing in the way of critical thinking or interesting problem solving will be experienced here.

They also ghosted after the interview, another black mark.

Rutgers also doesn't pay much, I got two offers just a couple weeks later for 60% more than they offered and then after a couple months an offer for twice as much.
Interview Questions:
1. What does M.V.N. mean to you?

2. Java OOP trivia.

3. What is a singleton?

4. What is a SQL db? (Didn't clarify if relational or noSQL, and didn't clarify when pressed on it. Clearly didn't know the difference themselves and was flustered)

title: Adminsitrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The first one started with a phone call interview and then a Zoom call with 3 interviewers.  This went really well. 
I had another Zoom call interview from a different department which did not go well.
Interview Questions:
What kind of Management experience do I have?
How would you deal with a diverse environment?
What kind of software have I used?

title: Student Center Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and easy going, there was not much technical questions, most of it was behavioral questions. The one behavioral question was to test if you knew what basic AV stuff did
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in a team?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 2 managers at the same time for over 2 hours and needed to give a 15 minute presentation after. Standard interview questions ranging from job history to specific projects details.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your present company?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Rutgers' career portal. The interview experience was toxic. Also my mistake was I should've never applied for a part-time position while looking for a full-time position. At the very beginning, they asked me and all other candidates to attend a "training" for a whole day on zoom !! We were asked to read the survey question by question (role play) for 6 hours! Then I was given a second-round interview with the team. They asked me my data skills and other work experiences. I specifically told them I didn't know SAS. They said it would be ok. They mentioned they would give me another round of interview to test my language skills and a skill test to do. After a few days, I did a third-round interview with a data analyst in another language. Then I did a forth-round interview that only lasted for 10 min with another lady! The lady confirmed my data skills and I told her I didn't know SAS. I could only do the test in R or Stata. She said no problem and then sent me a test that had to be down in SAS. I got so mad and felt they had been wasting my time. In order to be transformed to be a full-time, you need to work part-time for 6 months and get pass. It is extremely toxic and I encourage every one to look for somewhere else
Interview Questions: Why do you apply for this position

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Remote interview over Zoom with two higher ups. The questions were generic. The tone was less friendly than I’ve encountered in most other interviews. This was the first interview in (I think) a two round process. I went with another opportunity before hearing back.
Interview Questions: What is your Excel proficiency?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward interview process and took less than 10 minutes through a phone call. The interviewer asked questions pertaining to the responsibilities of the job and my experience related to the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous research experience?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Basic interviewing and behavioral questions over the phone, then an in-person interview asking about interests and other topics relating to the position, followed up with an acceptance or denial within the week
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this position?

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Had phone interview. I thought it went well. No one ever called for a follow up or emailed. I would have appreciated something either way. Interview was short and not too difficult.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Talk with PI about the your career goal and post research projects, what you can bring to the team, also the description of the projects the PI has, the team size, and job description.
Interview Questions: Can you introduce me your PHD project?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and straight forward. Know your stuff and just talk technical. Interpersonal skills are important for the job, but not during the interview. I followed my resume and talked about the education, experiences, and courses that were relevant to the position and answered the interviewer's questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for me?

title: Research Assistance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The job sounded like a lot of work and very little pay.  Also did not sense much growth beyond entry level position. Did not seem like the best of fit for me.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a project you managed

title: Resarch Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It took about three weeks or so to get an interview and it was done virtually. They asked standard interview questions based on the resume and previous industry experience. Overall, it was a smooth experience.
Interview Questions: They asked me to talk about my previous experience.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions:
The professor's team is very nice. Process goes great. 
First, meet the professor, and then go to the seminar room to present and Q&A.  after that, meet with other professors and scientists from the lab and the department and HR. cool
Interview Questions: very specific science questions and discussed details

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: extremely long process with little communication in between waiting to hear if you got the job. the people are very nice but it’s a waiting game. I still have not heard back as they are still interviewing candidates after a month
Interview Questions: What is your experience pertaining to this position?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Asked for lesson plan sample, experience with classroom teaching, college education, and knowledge of course content. Wasn't too stressful in my opinion. My interview was for the Academic Foundations Center for the Trio Talent Search.
Interview Questions: Q. Tell me about yourself and why are you interested?

title: Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Was called to meet with the Compensation Manager and another person 2 times.  After my 3rd interview with a more senior person I was never got a call back or rejection letter.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current employer?

title: Application Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Went in and talked briefly about past projects / experiences; then was asked a number of trivia type questions about the technologies and relevant concepts for the role I was applying for. I was asked to bring code samples of a past project.
Interview Questions: After looking at a code sample of a previous project I worked on, they asked what I might do differently now and how would I make it more maintainable.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the career portal as soon as it was posted. I heard back from them and got the 1st round of interview soon. Interviewers were friendly and asked some behavioral questions and a lot of technical questions related to their machine learning project. Then I was asked to provide 3 references. The next day when they finished talking with my references, I received a verbal offer.
Interview Questions: How do you use machine learning to solve xx this problem? What are the steps?

title: Special Collection Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I talked with the head of the department for some time about my interests in the field. With my skills and interests decided we discussed the openings that were available.
Interview Questions: What is your computer literacy?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions, behavioral questions and general things about your resume. They reply back pretty quickly. Friendly interviewers and nice people overall. You have to go in and talk to them face to face. No need to be a cs major just tech related is good
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What experience do you have?

title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: One main interviewer who introduced me to her mgr and several of the other staffmembers.  Very informal and friendly. The interview took about 30 minutes, followed by a review of procedures to complete the hiring process.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my background that qualified me to speak on my subject matter.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I scrolled through the Aresty portal and found a position that matched my coursework and interests quite well, and after submitting the typical supporting documents, received a phone call with the chief researcher of this project who turned out to be an extremely fascinating person with a depth of experience both in academia and in the "field". I did not hear back for five or so months.
Interview Questions: Are you particularly attached to being a research assistant through aresty?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Team interview with multiple people. Was mostly behavioral in nature. You get observed by the hiring staff in teaching situations. You are given different scenarios in which you must create lesson plans or react to something.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a learning assistant?

title: Learning Assistance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process with okay. We have been seating in groups and each group got asked questions. I can say that it’s not technical interview. So have fun it. Ask questions, allow your other group-mate to talk and listen to them.
Interview Questions: Some non technical questions like challenges you faced and stuff.

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview, I just applied and got it. All you need to do is apply to get in.  Just make sure you apply to the right campus or you'll have a mistake.
Interview Questions: They did not ask any questions.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I gave a talk and met with some people - great atmosphere. Very academic and devoted to research and students.  Just very upbeat.   Probably the most upbeat from all universities I have ever interviewed.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I had applied for a position back in October and received an e-mail to schedule a phone interview in December. Hours after the phone interview, I sent a thank you e-mail. Weeks pass and I hear absolutely nothing back. I sent a follow-up e-mail in those three weeks asking the interviewer to at least let me know where we are in the process. There was still no reply. Almost 2 months pass and the only communication I receive is a no-reply generic e-mail (not from the person who interviewed me) basically stating that I did not get the position.
It's really an inconvenience to take the time out to thank the person who interviewed and to follow up only to receive no feedback at all. It exhibits apathy toward the candidate's time and it's very unfair.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process started off well. They brought me in for 3 in-person interviews with members of various teams. The interviews were pretty standard. They asked me multiple questions about my past experience as well as things that I would be comfortable doing in this new role. Everyone I met was nice and the interview process was smooth. It seemed like a good place to work and I was excited to join the team. I received a phone call with a verbal offer the day after my last interview. This is where everything went downhill.

The salary they offered was low, so naturally I asked for a higher salary, to which they refused to even negotiate. I then said I would have to think about it. They told me that they would move on if I didn't get back to them within 2 weeks. I called my contact back 6 days later and again tried to negotiate for a higher salary, although this time I significantly lowered the salary I asked for. I also said that I would be accepting the offer regardless but I wanted to be sure the salary couldn't be slightly higher. He said he would speak to his boss about it. He called me back later that day to say that the 1 person who could approve a higher salary was out of the office for the week and that they would contact me when they were back in the office. 

After this call, one of my references called me to "congratulate" me on my new position. My reference said he wasn't sure if he should be congratulating me though because the person who reached out to him from Rutgers said that I wasn't going to accept the offer because the salary was too low. I thought it was extremely unprofessional that my contact would share private information like this with my references. I reached back out to my Rutgers contact who didn't pick up. I thought that was strange but I waited another week before contacting my contact again. He didn't pick up. He continued to dodge my phone calls and emails for almost 2 weeks before finally calling me again. He said that they went with another person because I had apparently waited too long to give them my decision. I said that I had accepted their offer less than a week after they gave it to me. He acknowledged that I had accepted the offer and said that me waiting plus asking for a higher salary played a part in them deciding to rescind my offer. I was kind of stunned that they kept me in the dark for so long to buy themselves times to find a replacement for me. 

Lesson learned. If you're applying for a full-time position at Rutgers - the number at the lowest end of the band in the job posting is the salary you will be offered, don't try to negotiate with Rutgers whatsoever, and accept their first offer immediately or they will pull it from underneath you. What started out as a pleasant and relatively painless interview process quickly turned into a nightmare.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple deadlines?

title: Human Resources Interview

Before the call, she asked me when I would be able to come in for an in-person interview as they were "moving quickly". We discussed a tentative date and she told me she would confirm by email if the date worked. It is now 4 weeks later and I have yet to hear from anyone even after sending a thank you email that they could have easily replied to if they decided to go in a different direction.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: TLDR: Bad experience, disorganized HR. I applied online in April 2019 and had a phone interview in May. I’m a Canadian citizen, so during my interview I notified my interviewer of the (free, very easy) work authorization I would need, and followed up afterwards with a memo; I was assured that it wasn’t an issue. They offered me the job in June.  I accepted in July. At the end of July, shortly before I was supposed to start, I was informed that HR reinterpreted their policy on hiring Canadians and they were considering rescinding the offer. Several weeks passed, during which time my previous visa (which I’d calibrated to align with my scheduled Rutgers start date) ended and I had to leave the country. About a week after I was supposed to start work, they rescinded my offer. HR never apologized to me or accepted responsibility for their error. This was a serious personal, professional and financial setback for me.  Future applicants, I strongly suggest that you continue to apply for other positions, and do not retract your other applications,  even after you formally accept a job offer at Rutgers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Great communication throughout the process. Three step in person interview process including two individual interviews and one panel interview. Once I accepted the offer, there was a process to go through including a background check and medical screening.
Interview Questions: What’s your experience doing this work in the healthcare field?

title: OIT Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Unnecessarily hard interview for a rather unimportant part-time job. One of the supervisor was being a little harsh and intimidating. Timed skill tests on a computer where the supervisor would allow random number of minutes to solve a computer application related question. Googling was however allowed.
Interview Questions: to solve hypothetical computer application related questions

title: Laboratory Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was contacted two months later for a phone interview. The phone interview was over an hour, at the end I was invited to come in for an in person. The in person took place the next week, I was told at the end of the week I received the position and was chosen. It took two weeks with interviews and waiting for the decision.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this job? Why do you love science?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Talent Acquisition recruited me - 2 phone interviews and one in-person interview. Was fairly easy - small department so I met with all colleagues. It took about 2 hours but the turn around was 2 days when I got the offer.
Interview Questions: Why Rutgers?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University (Linden, NJ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on a Sunday night and received a call on Monday to schedule a phone interview. Had the phone interview and thought it went well. For some reason the application was on Indeed.com instead of the regular university job posting site. Was invited for an in person interview. Met some people in the office and completed an interview with the person who was leaving and who would train me. Was pleasant, gave me more insight on the job duties. Followed up with a thank you note right away and follow up email 3 weeks later. I was asked to be patient. No letter or email was sent saying the standard message of sorry you were not what we were looking for etc., just no communication months later and I saw a new posting posted for the same department in a part time capacity so maybe they didn’t have the funds to hire full time.
Interview Questions:
Standard questions were asked that pertained to the job.

Tell me about yourself.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two phases. One was a group interview, one was an individual interview.  The group interview looked for teamwork and leadership. The individual looked for problem solving skills, and how you deal with challenging scenarios.
Interview Questions: Generic interview questions, working together, facing challenges, knowledge of resources

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Personal conversation and Skype call with both bosses with whom I was applying. We had a relaxed conversation and projected about what would be needed and how I would meet those needs.
Interview Questions: What were my relevant experiences.

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview is a single group interview. You are given tasks to do in groups and they rate you based on your interaction with the group. The groups are of about 5-6 people and there are a total of about 6 groups per session.
Interview Questions: Give constructive criticism to the person next to you in the group and they will give you constructive criticism as well.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for a technical subject and hence technical. Coding questions comprised the majority of the interview and some theoretical questions too. I was also asked to demonstrate a project that I had done using the R-studio software.
Interview Questions: What are the projects that you have done using R-studio?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Group Interviews with different group activities. Specific subjects and specific roles may have one to one interviews. Interviews are easy and test communication, listening and people's skills. Easy interview, group interviews not based on the subjects.
Interview Questions: With your group decide which is an important quality a learning assistant must possess?

title: Help Desk Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The process is very easy for someone who is serious.  You are given a booklet to study over the summer and at the end of the summer your knowledge is tested through a test on the computer and if you pass you are hired.
Interview Questions: First interview asks why you want to do this job.

title: Information Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Mostly there to get a sense of who the applicant is as a person and whether or not they are good natured and willing to learn; having prior extensive technological experience is not required.
Interview Questions: Why would a keyboard not work?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty calm, was not too hard. The managers were really cool and it was not a stressful environment. The interview was easy as there seems to be a lot of turnover in this place. I would interview here.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy technical interview.. They wanted to hire someone who has previous experience in business and analytics as well as someone who had handled companies profile.  I had 5 years of experience in business management and analytics so it was very easier for me to crack the interview
Interview Questions: easy questions about  SQL, Tableau and python

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was very straight forward and the interview team was great. I discussed with the manager the role over the phone and in person before completing a swim and lifeguarding test.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fair interview, asked mostly situational questions. Asked to provide examples of leadership and marketing-related experience. Also asked why I was interested in the role and how I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the role?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then passed a phone screen. Shortly afterward, I was invited to a face-to-face interview. Both phone screen and face-to-face interview took 1 hour each.  Staff was pleasant throughout the process and listened to my answers intently.
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be in the next five years?

title: Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about what my goals were upon graduating college. What skills I could bring to the team. The interview felt very informal, as the department was rather small. Although I was never asked to perform a code challenge, I was asked the basics of how I would tackle problems with code.
Interview Questions: What classes would you be interested in taking before graduation?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was relatively smooth.  The 2 interviewers were very professional, yet made it very casual, I definitely felt at ease.  They clearly explained to me what the position was and what was expected in this new position created for a team of research members.   During my second interview, I first met with a doctor (the main person that the secretary would work closely with), and then the interview proceeded to a panel of 5 people  (the team members).  All team members seemed very pleasant.  However, it was a little intense and unexpected.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that you can bring to the team?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is a group interview. People are getting together to talk about your idea about how to teaching international students. The advisors will observe your behaviors and value them.
Interview Questions: Do you have any recommendation for teaching international students?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with about five professors from the department. In between interviews, I was back to a common room where I could talk to graduate students. I also went to a lab meeting.
Interview Questions: The first and foremost question is "tell me about your research."  Follow-up questions depend on your specific research area.

title: Lecture Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The group interview is not to see if you are smart, but instead to see if you can cooperate. Just be polite and engage in the discussion and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: They ask a simple question that you and the group have to solve collaboratively.

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: -Group interview, very easy. Just one interview in total. The overall process was just that they wanted to see if I had gotten at least a B+ in the class I was applying to be a learning assistant at first for.
Interview Questions: What was one time you worked effectively in a group?

title: Head Chef Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was good. Took 2 weeks, everyone i dealt with was nice and professional. This job is a difficult job to find and acquire. Once you get a job with rutgers you get great benifits.
Interview Questions: How do you make a PB&J

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: submit the CV and cover letter. got E-mail back in 3 days with a positive response. set up the next interview, and one day visit and presentation and  got an offer at the end of the day
Interview Questions: background and technical skills

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview then a one on one interview. The group interview was a couple of activities that wanted to see how you would work in a group. As for the one-on-one interviews, these were primarily behavioral questions that just wanted to get to know you as a person.
Interview Questions: How would you design an article of clothing if you could choose anything?

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Jersey City, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very calm and relaxing. When I walked in there was no fear. They welcome everyone with open arms and make the interview a lot less stressful. All the managers are nice and its a great work environment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and what is your major?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The process was not long. First introduce yourself and watch two video to discuss in groups about what should a good teaching  assistant do when handling students' problems. Later discuss what it the perfect scenario for a LA. In the last, everyone shared advantages and constructive suggestions of their group members.
Interview Questions: Describe the perfect scenario for a Learning Assistant when solving students' problems

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Orlando, FL) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Midyear in Orlando, FL - chaotic with hundreds of applicants applying to various positions. It feels a little like a zoo. There is a lot of energy. It is still enjoyable. Be yourself and enjoy the process.
Interview Questions: How many people in the US are frying a sunny side up egg at 6am in NY on a Saturday in July?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Edison, NJ) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a casual interview. Most of the questions were about my background, what kind of courses i had taken and what my interests are. Also why I would like to work there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Rutgers University?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: They post up papers of hiring CITs each fall semester. Getting the call is competitive. Once you do, u meet with a couple of supervisors and go through several behavioral questions as well as some critical thinking and personality based questions.
Interview Questions: fire alarm went off but student has to finish his paper, how do you get him to leave the building?

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position about a month and a half before receiving an email from the manager requesting me to go in for an interview the next week.  I met with her and she was extremely nice and explained the position in very great detail. She told me she would contact me by the end of the week to let me know if I was chosen for a second interview which I was.  I went to the second interview exactly a week later and was contacted the next morning stating I was the candidate they chose.  I received a call from HR stating they have an offer and they sent over paperwork for me to fill out.  Everything so far seems to be moving very quickly and I am very excited to begin this new chapter of my life.
Interview Questions: The one dreading question is why should we choose you out of all the candidates?  What makes you the best for this position?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It was a very welcoming experience that allowed me to get familiar with the type of tasks and jobs I will be involved with.   The questions definitely allowed for me to answer based on my experience in a law enforcement setting.
Interview Questions: What are some weaknesses that you may have and what have you done to mitigate them?

title: Spanish Medical Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Super nice people! felt very comfortable talking about my experience. I was a bit nervous because it was when I recently had started my fall semester but they were great
Interview Questions: I was asked if I had any previous experience and why I thought I was fit for the position.

title: Chandler Health Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two separate interviews and the whole process took roughly 2.5 months. The first interview lasted nearly three hours and it was more the interviewer describing the job role to me and commenting on the past and future of the program as well as my past work experiences.
Interview Questions: How will your past experiences help you in this role?

title: User Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 3 interviewers.  Interviewers began by introducing themselves and telling their backgrounds.  Interview consisted of personality/situational questions and about 9 technical questions.  Mostly related to Cisco networking, routing & switching.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between a Static & dynamic IP addresses?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions:
i applied online and, after a few months passed, was invited for an on-site interview. i was interviewed by a would-be coworker and manager at the same time.

coworker was polite but manager was pretty rude when he asked me questions. i didn't like his attitude at all. it was difficult to strike up any kind of conversation/"get the ball rolling" since the manager definitely did not want to be in that room with me.

very dissatisfied.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Student Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Most of the questions are either Job Specific or research oriented. There are about Three rounds with professors, May vary depending on the department. They may ask a case study on some of the on going research. Questions on prior experiences.
Interview Questions: They gave me a programming assignment and asked me to write code infant of them.

title: Campus Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: A Two round interview process.  Phone interview for first round and in-person interview for second round.  No presentation needed during the second round of interview.  Met most of the mid-level and senior staff in department.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience and why you feel this is a good fit for your career

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Application was online. I was interviewed by phone with a professor in the department I was applying for. Also I was emailed by a few current students of the department to understand the culture and experience. Overall, pretty good experience. This is for a graduate program in Busch Campus.
Interview Questions: research interest

title: Business Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Camden, NJ) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about 3 weeks later I was emailed and asked for a phone interview, I had one the next day, then a week later I was asked to come on campus and interview with a panel. I was told I would have a decision by the next week. I then received an email asking to come to the department and meet with the other people in the department so they can go over the job and what it entails. I was told numerous times that I would be fine when I started and I would learn by hands on experience. I was under the assumption that I was getting the job the way they talked to me. I then met with the same person I was in contact with throughout the process and asked again which position I was interested in (the temp or perm one) and he informed me I should here within the next two days. A week and a half later I had to email him to find out I did not get the job and they never gave me a reason. Total waste of time.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you over the other candidates?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It took 11 days after submitting my application to get a call back. I had a brief phone screening and then an in-person interview with 2 people the next day. It was a very easy interview given that I had previously worked with the department as an undergraduate student and was already familiar with the staff there. I'm sure this aided me significantly thus this may not be a fair or neutral review on the interview process for someone else coming in with no prior history with the staff, department, or school.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this department/position?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I received an email to come on campus and interview for a position. The process was very laid back, very easy. Questions were basic interview questions. This position seemed to cater highly to recent graduates.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the company?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview first then an in person interview with four people, 3 men 1 woman.  Everyone read their questions off the same Rutgers sample interview question sheet.  Even though there were four people I could tell who would ultimately decide on the candidate.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position?

title: Summer Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It's pretty simple. You go in and they literally give you scenarios and problems and ask for times when you were faced with them and how you overcame them. If you answer genuinely of any obstacles you overcame you'll be alright.
Interview Questions: Tell us about one time when you were faced with a very difficult situation that presented roadblocks and how did you end up overcoming them?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I submit a bunch of applications online, and the committee reviewed and then decided quickly to hire me. The result comes pretty surprisingly, because there is no more interview in between, like Duke that did a phone interview.
Interview Questions: typical application

title: Research and Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: well it was great but not too great because it had several issues within the process. The HR were not to happy when I saw them because it was in the summer but thankfully I got though the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me the time about your leadership position in the club?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: interview process was not difficult, just required to show you can perform the task well and will on time and dedicated to work. they don't ask too many questions
Interview Questions: have you worked at one of our other locations

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: situational questions, behavioral questions, General questions about yourself and what makes you different from other candidates. practice asking yourself questions to prepare so that you will be ready to answer whatever they throw at you
Interview Questions: What are your strongest and weakest attributes?

title: Dean's Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very casual, conversational, while maintaining a professional attitude.  The interview did not take as long as I thought... I was in and out in under 15 minutes.  Dressed business casual.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experiences.

title: Lead Peer Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview wasn't hard. I had two interviewers for my position. They were very friendly and welcoming.  Most of the questions were about my experiences that I listed on the resume and my previous on campus jobs/involvement
Interview Questions: What do you think might be struggle for you in this job?

title: Estimator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Both interviews seemed to go very well.  Oddly though, the second interview was 6 weeks after the first interview.  In the second interview, I was told that in addition to estimation duties, I would need to be a change agent for the highly dysfunctional facilities department.  I made a good case for my being able to do that gracefully.  
I was told I would be contacted by phone, by one of the interviewers "early next week"
10 days later I phoned the only guy I'd interviewed with twice.  I was very uncomfortable about my phoning him.  (But was never given an HR contact....)  I was told I'd learn "soon".
Two weeks later I call the VP, with whom I'd interviewed.  She yelled at me saying that it was "highly inappropriate" that I contacted her.  I ended the phone call calmly.  Two months later I received a form-letter email from HR saying they'd chosen another candidate.  Rather anticlimactic at that point.  Why even bother?
Interview Questions: They administer a test - to have you estimate a job from LF, SF, Man-hours, etc.  It's not hard but the spreadsheet is not well laid out.  I also wondered if asbestos removal (which wasn't costed out, but was mentioned) was something of a trick question

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Called in for group interview where several general team questions asked. Given a scenario describe what you would do. Be able to give criticism to peers. Interview process was around 30 mins to 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Give constructive criticism of a peer in your group

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online from India. In the mathematics department they admit students every alternate year (at Rutgers-Newark). They did not apply any graduate students the year I applied, so they kept my application for consideration during the next academic year.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CSO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: You sit in front of a panel of three people who take turns asking you questions.  It's mostly behavioral and situational questions.  You should come with resumes and in business formal attire, so a suit and tie for example.  Personally, I didn't find the interview tough, but I have heard from many other employees and potential employees that they did find it tough.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?  Why do you want to be a CSO?  "What would you do if...." questions.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position online, and a few days after the posting closed , I was invited for an interview by phone. I attended the in person interview about a week after the phone call. The interview (with two people) lasted about an hour. I was informed that there was another tier of interviews to follow so I'm currently waiting for a call back.
Interview Questions: We discussed the duties of my last (current) job at length.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: On January, I applied online, and waited for two weeks for the interview invitation. It was an in-person interview and the whole interview last for half hour. The interview went well, and the hiring person was nice and helpful.
Interview Questions: What do you know about development

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, in-person interview for a group, final interview with two Supervisors. It was fine until after the last interview when I was sent extremely mixed messages by hiring manager who at first wanted to meet again but then after not responding to my email decided to finally reply back and say they had moved on. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an under performing employee?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was simple phone screening and then F2F at their location. There were very logical questions. they mainly test your logic.They give you scenario and ask you questions on the basis of that
Interview Questions: what is inheritence

title: PC Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: i applied online, the process took 2 months. then i was called for an interview. when i arrived the manager asked most common questions like any interview. then i was hired after a month
Interview Questions: questions about previous experience

title: Head Bottle Washer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Cave in Rock, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was good it was nice it was fair they were not mean they were nice to me I liked interview very much. Very good nice place. I like it
Interview Questions: Do you like turtles or zombies

title: Global Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Well one you have had to study abroad at least a year, a semester, or during one of the breaks. Once you have done that than you will be asked during your semester or week overseas if you would like to partake in the Global Ambassador.
Interview Questions: what did study abroad do for you, and do you feel a change ?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: One in person interview followed by an online writing test. A few back and forth emails with hiring manager and another school administrator.  Good overall interview experience as a whole
Interview Questions: What do you hope to accomplish from this experience

title: IT Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: you can apply online thru their website and HR will contact you if you're qualified. then normally it will be a phone interview, then you wait. the manager will give you a call to interview you. it was just basic questions and not sure if they were really looking to hire or just fulfill a quota
Interview Questions: how do you describe yourself as an employee

title: Secretary of Graduate Student Association Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a polling system where a candidate had to get votes from peers to be appointed for the position. Once a candidate was selected, an interview with the previous committee was conducted to chose the right candidate
Interview Questions:
Why do you want the position?
What would you bring to the team?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is quite standard for higher education. You have a panel of people  Dean, HR, coordinator, faculty member, and someone who works in career services. They are looking for someone who is a fit and someone who knows how to facilitate student success more than anything.  However, competition in this field is exteremely high. If you do not stand out someone will get the job over you.
Interview Questions: Greatest accomplishments

title: Habilitation Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: First you get a call and then they set up a interview. But 20 people interviewing for one position. The lady was really nice. Interview took about 30 minutes. You meet wity one person. They explsin the position to you. They let you kno that the hiring processs takes about 3 months
Interview Questions: They gave you a scenario abiut working with clients in the field.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by the employee there and then discussed with the department chair about some more personal information about myself, mainly about the academic background. Then he made the decision.
Interview Questions: When will you get your Ph.D. degree?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to a professor of mine during the school year outside of class and requested an RA position. She asked to see several writing samples. transcripts, along with other documents and I eventually got the position.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
