Interview Descriptions: First, you need to submit application along with your resume, and then they will ask you to go to one of the information sessions if you are selected. At the end of information session, you need to sign up the one-to-one interview, and then do the interview, after a few days, the program coordinator will email you if you are selected or not.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the director of the center, received a reply to set up a phone interview. Easy phone interview and received a response within 4 weeks that I got the job.
Interview Questions: few technical skills and a lot of behavior questions.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick responses and everything was coordinated efficiently, there was email communication with the agenda and I received phone calls quickly. Met with the manager first then the nurses and doctors on separate days .
Interview Questions: Why interested in this field

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is done in a group of 6 people. There are some group activities you have to complete. Older Learning assistant will observe you while you completing these task.
Interview Questions: how would you plan a lesson for students?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Did a data analysis problem about survival analysis. Interviewed about those questions:
1. Briefly explain the reason why we do survival analysis
2.Why do we use Weibull distribution rather than Exponential distribution
3. How to select 4 important variables from 20 variables
4. How to solve overfitting problem
Interview Questions: Describe the usage of survival analysis.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Camden, NJ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, it usually takes 3-7 business days for them to reply. If you are qualified then they will call or email you about the days in which you are available to schedule for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Student Accounting and Cashiering?

title: Senior Care Coordination Speciaist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager contacted me via telephone to set up an interview. i interviewed in person for about 1 hour. hr followed up with 3 references for background check. there was delay in reaching all references. i was offered the position about a month after the interview. there was limited space for salary negotiation. once you are hired with rutgers, it is very unlikely to receive significant raises. as a result, you must push for a high salary up front.
Interview Questions: tell us about a difficult experience with a coworker

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of an in-person meet up with the Human Resource Manager after she reviewed my online application. After deeming me fit for the next round, she scheduled another meeting with the department chair. The second interview was pretty informal and more about giving me a sense of my duties.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in the position and if I would consider transitioning into a more permanent position?

title: Tester Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Interview went very well and was very nice people.  We spoke of the knowledge trends over the pas few years and disc. possibility of the future.  I have already given all info I know now.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Boiler Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: question answer filling out papers going though the process of telling about my self what are my goals what do i have to offer the company as to my work and loyalty to my fellow workers
Interview Questions: how did i found about the job

title: Phone Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I met with the program manager and some scenarios were presented to me that callers might speak about and I had to describe how I would handle them. We did a little role-playing with mock conversations, and afterward we discussed my answers (what I said that was good and what I said that might have been improved).
Interview Questions: About my experience, but mostly about the scenarios as i mentioned.

title: Freelance Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: A phone call was how I was interviewed.  A few questions were asked about the services I could offer and my availably for quick turnarounds. They were interested in mostly print work.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have specifically with print graphic design?

title: PTL Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: This job looks for presentation skills. So, in your resume while you apply make sure you highlight them instead of just your knowledge about Software Engineer. Give presentation skills in your resume and apply them in interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They asked me questions, asked to see me demonstrate my teaching, and wanted a curriculum vitae.  They wanted to know the comprehensive nature of my knowledge, professional experience, activites, publications.
Interview Questions: Describe your teaching philosophy?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Camden, NJ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30 minute interview. The question were simple and they were straight forward about job requirements. The staff was really nice. I went through two rounds of interview. The second one was with the Director. She didn't seem as prepared for the interview.
Interview Questions:
What are your 5 year and 10 year goals?
What is the most difficult situation you've experienced in this position?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Overview of overall research process being conducted. Standard back and forth interviewing process. Depending on the field and position,previous knowledge will be required. They provide on the job training. Looking for overall, independent, competent individuals.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Head Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
2 people interviewed me (a man and a woman) and they asked me 1) my strengths 2) my weaknesses and how I deal with them 3) why I want to work for Rutgers 4) why should they hire me (what makes me the best candidate 5) computer skills

They told me it would take 3 weeks to go through human resources. Then they gave me their business cards. Today makes it exactly 3 weeks and no word yet but I'm still hopeful I will receive good news this week.

This interview was like your average interview except with two people. I thought it was going to be more of a people approach job but after the interview I realized its more of an IT tech job. But I'm up for the challenge.
Interview Questions: 1) my strengths 2) my weaknesses and how I deal with them 3) why I want to work for Rutgers 4) why should they hire me (what makes me the best candidate 5) computer skills

title: Computer Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was longer than I anticipated but they tested a variety of fields. They asked personality and situational questions along with tech questions where you actually had to demonstrate your knowledge of technology. This included determining log-on issues all the way to dealing with excel, word, and powerpoint. There was also some work with photoshop and saving files in some manner.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you found a random brick laying around the building?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience, they asked technical questions and it all worked out in the end. They really helped me grow as a person, both in the CS Industry and in my academic career.
Interview Questions: What is your name?

title: Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with three members from the department and mostly learned more about the position. They were very friendly, but they were clearly looking for someone with specific technical qualifications I do not possess.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an unhappy client?

title: Health Care Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview of three people - the nurse manager, social worker, and nurse practitioner. The interview lasted approximately one hour. As a current Rutgers employee, I was advised upon arrival that this was just a "formality". The mood was light and the conversation easy. Due to the similarity of in work history and the position for which I was interviewing, the questions were limited. The panel spent most of the time discussing their program and the job role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to step down from a leadership position into a staff nurse position?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application is available via the school's sakai site.  There is a group interview and then two subsequent individual interviews.  Overall, its the first two that are most important.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Not much of a interview, it had pretty generic questions. These questions were pretty standard to all interviews that are conducted at the university, I believe.  Room was non-intimidating, and it was a pretty lax interview.
Interview Questions: Name a strength and weakness.

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual. You'll want to dress casually, or wear a suit if that's your style, although business casual is more well-received.  They ask questions aimed around figuring out what kind of person you are, your technical skill, knowledge, and previous experience working with computers. Demonstrate your worth and they'll scoop you up.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were alone on shift and a fire alarm went off?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was brief. Once you go in, you know you are hired because you go in because you are accepted from a bunch of people. It is definitely hard to get into. You have to have connections to get in.
Interview Questions: Why you need job?

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quick process that lasted about 3 weeks. Applied online and received a call within a few days. Met with two hiring managers for a 30 minute interview. Simple questions about myself and relating to previous work stated on my resume.  They just want to make sure you're willing to learn and work as a team with others. Questions relating to situational problems and what you would do.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer persistently wants to take food home when we have a clear no food outside the venue policy

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a call and was asked why I am interested in becoming a Ph.D. I was also asked about my math and coding skills. The professor also asks me if I am interested in the accounting area.
Interview Questions: Do you want to be in the academic area when you graduate

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: We met in her office and had a quick excel test. We then talked about my past experiences and how long i would be in school for. Then we discussed how much I knew about the nursing school and the program.
Interview Questions: What roals in managmnt have you had

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Meet with management of department he or she explain about the position and I give them my duties of my passed employment responsibilities.  If we both have any question about the position to get a better understanding about the position we continue.  But, if there question and conversation is ended.  The response from management you will hear back by the end of the week.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working with people?

title: Human Resources Staff Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Was called by interviewer to come in and meet with a manager. There was a total of two interviews before I was selected for the position. I met with different people each time I was interviewed. Everyone was very nice and personable. I was called with an offer within a week of my second interview.
Interview Questions: How would you assist an employee who came in with a question but was not clear in their directions?

title: Child and Adolescent Psychiatry Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The program director who interviewed me was great but unfortunately he is leaving by the end of June and no enough staff to run the program. No enough attendings and no structured didactics. The University cut our salaries and CIR is fighting back.
Interview Questions: No challenging questions

title: RTS I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Most of the times, preference is given to internal candidates. Once you apply for the open position on the website, the resumes are shortlisted. At least 5 candidates are interviewed and the top selected 1 or 2 are contacted by HR for salary updates and background check. once approved you undergo general health and TB test and are hired once clearance is obtained
Interview Questions:
they ask about the skills and the number of hours you can work.
Also about salary expectations

title: Professional Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: They call you and you get interviewed on the phone.  You wait about a week and then they call you again to tell you if you got the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you solved a problem at your previous job.

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The woman who interviewed me asked basic questions about myself and why I was interested in working for an educational institution that is Rutgers University. Then she asked me where I saw myself in the team and how I could contribute my skills to their projects.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions about prior research experience, type of research, papers published. Also questions about type of research you are interested in and why you want to work in that research group
Interview Questions: What type of research did you work on?

title: Helpdesk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It started via email, getting basic information than you set up an interview that lasts about 15-30 minutes. The questions are a lot about your work ethics and how hard of a worker you are. A lot of the technical stuff is taught on site so these questions really focus on how well you would work with the team.
Interview Questions: One thing they asked me was my history and where I worked.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an email requesting phone interview at first, lasted about 20 minutes with 3 people asking standard interview questions. A few days later I was sent an email again, this time for an in-person interview. I was sent very detailed directions as well as an interview itinerary. Interview lasted about 3.5 hours, panel interview, everyone had a list of questions. Two days later I was informed that I was moving on in the interview process and they requested references. Two days later got a call with the offer.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Rutgers? What attracted you to this position? What skills do you have?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Interview Process was moderate. Importance was given on depth of knowledge about the subject and future aims. The interview process mainly consists of a telephonic interview, followed by a power point presentation of the major focus area, followed by specific questions on career goals and aims
Interview Questions: Future aims within the next five years

title: Administrative Assistant (Part Time) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a call back the following day to schedule a meeting the day after. Very fast process. Met with 2 people who asked questions from a sheet of paper but nothing difficult. Laid back, very friendly. I think my mistake was letting them know that I wasn't hoping to build a career there or in that field - though I thought it was understood seeing as it was only a part time position and my resume had no indication of pursuing a career in that department.
Interview Questions: What can you do to create a good work environment? Why this position? How do you juggle and prioritize tasks? What's one thing that we didn't ask you that you were expecting us to and how would you answer it? Tell us about a time you dealt with a difficult client and how did you handle it? Tell us about a time you received horrible customer service and how would you have handled it differently.

title: NCS Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was about an hour, and a very laid back group interview. There was a quiz beforehand for around 20 minutes. 3 supervisors were there and they asked about prior experience with an emphasis on customer service (asked us how our previous experiences would relate to the new job)
Interview Questions: Questions specific to Mac and  Windows systems. Asked which wires correlate which use.

title: Rutgers Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward. I, as well as another candidate, was interviewed by two assistant coordinators and a head guard. They asked us what saving techniques were appropriate for certain situations, what are the responsibilities of a lifeguard, and gave us scenarios and asked us how to deal with them.
Interview Questions: What/who are high risk swimmers?

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite straightforward.  I was called for an interview less than a week after I applied for the position and was offered the position about 10 days after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why would someone with a research background be better suited for this position than someone with a clinical background?

title: Gardening Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I think if i remember correctly they maybe asked me the very very basic questions about my previous expect nicest in different kind of jobs and different kinds of different em ployments and other stuff related to that past  stuff it was all very easy and  all everyone was actually very very  nice  ok
Interview Questions: What was your last job like

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It was relaxed. Submit CV and letter to chair.  Arrange meeting.  See if there's match. Negotiate there after.  Could spend more time negotiating after.  Can come back for a second look.  Can ask colleagues to speak after hours.
Interview Questions: What's your vision for here.

title: Research Teaching Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by several Principal investigators and they all asked me questions. I was also first interviewed by the research director as well. Each PI took turns asking me questions about prior work experiences, academic experiences and education based questions. I was asked why I would like to work there. What's experiences make me suitable for the job.
Interview Questions: They asked me about the projects I have worked on and what it entailed

title: Summer Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions:
Talk with a professor, Ask for a research project during the semester

Most graduations apply with recommendations from a professor at Rutgers, in the ECE department

Mostly behavioral questions, however, GPA does matters

Try to take many courses early on, You are generally competing with other Rutgers ECE students

Talk with a professor, Ask for a research project during the semester

Most graduations apply with recommendations from a professor at Rutgers, in the ECE department

Mostly behavioral questions, however, GPA does matters

Try to take many courses early on, You are generally competing with other Rutgers ECE students
Interview Questions: What previous research experience do you have?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Had a ten minute interview with one of the Dean's assistant. When it came time to interview with the dean, 5 minutes into our interview, an HR rep was called in to clarify NJ state labor laws for about 10 minutes after which I was given an addition 3 minutes for my last words of the interview.
Interview Questions: What's the difference between a salaried and an hourly worker?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took 4 weeks to get a call, took another 2 weeks for phone interview - too long.  The phone interview was basic and related to my experiences and my resume.  I came with specific questions about working within Rutgers.  It would have been better to have a conversation with benefits/hr first to address these questions.  I ended up sending an email to hiring manager who forwarded onward.
Interview Questions: nothing out of ordinary - shocking not too much focus about working with students!

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Application- email or phone call for interview - get interviewed at the location or by phone - behavioral questions- was later sent samples of work to analyze and return to view work capability- was later offered.
Interview Questions: Difficult situation

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: One hour seminar and half an hour meeting with the hiring manager. I also met with the group for one hour while lunch. Expenses were paid by Rutgers. Easy and straightforward interview.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in program management?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with Graduate Student in order to enter a research position for the summer. One interview which was given at 7:30 am and had to find a ride myself there since the buses do not run that early in the morning. Was given the opportunity the next day.
Interview Questions: Take any piece of item around the room and tell me 20 things that you can do with it.

title: Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (East Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: We first had an over the phone interview and then an in person interview. Very professional. Very well done. Very genial professionals to deal with. Great organization. The Human Resources Department really works hard and is very communicative. They prepare you well and schedule everything accordingly.
Interview Questions: We talked about my background and the fit into higher education. We talked about Rutgers' reputation. i was asked to summarize my background.

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Panel type interview.  The questions were both technical and interpersonal- good balance. I thought the job requirements were explained thoroughly.  Process took about one and a half hour with a technical test at the end. You will be interviewing with the team members.
Interview Questions: What prompted you to seek employment at Rutgers?

title: Secretary Math Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and a couple days later received a phone call for setting up an interview. Only gave you one day and a small amount of time slots available. Made me assume they already had someone in mind.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work with multiple personalities and their scheduling needs?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the website as a student of Rutgers University. I received an email about an in person interview and was selected by project mentor. Discussed about resume and past experiences dealing with research. It was not that hard due to the direct needs I met with the current research project.
Interview Questions: How do your past experiences meet the needs of our current project?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: not many questions were asked, just the position was described and my interests were asked. i was referred by an employee, so i was almost directly recruited. Overall the interview was not so important
Interview Questions: what is my specific interest

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my cv, and just took one phone interview, and was hired. There was no technical question but simple question like when did you graduate, can you manage big class. I guess it is because the position was to teach undergraduate courses.
Interview Questions: When did you graduate? When did you obtain your degree?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to explain my experience on my resume, and tell the interviewer what I knew about the project the research group worked on. In addition to this, I was escorted around the facility, to show me the laboratories and their functions.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience in the laboratory.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: First I was contacted for a phone interview. This was a general discussion of what the job tasks were. I was then scheduled for an in-person interview. This started with a panel and then one-on-one with the program director. I was hired at the end of this process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in data analysis?

title: EOF TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process with leading professor. Was very familiar with the professor and she was very familiar with my academic record so it was an easy decision. Just asked general questions about availability and potentially dealing with young students and varying personalities.
Interview Questions: What courses have I taken to prepare me for this role?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the undergraduate career center; met a woman who was an assistant director. She could not have looked any more disinterested during our brief interview. It's like someone had dumped the task of interviewing on her and she resented it. So she asked me a couple of questions, I answered, trying to demonstrate some enthusiasm, trying to make some kind of connection with her. Then she asked me if I had any questions; I asked one, she made a quick reply, and then said, thanks for coming in. We left the conference room and walked back to her office. She opened the door, and I don't remember what I said exactly, something along the lines of thanks for meeting me, I'm really interested in the job, etc., smiling as I said it. What did she do? She frowns and slams the door in front of me.  Totally unprofessional
Interview Questions: What's your current salary?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was pretty straight forward. My prof. asked me few question, sadly its only based on your GPA so if you have a 4.0 then you are definitely getting the position. If not you need a ton of experience.
Interview Questions: What classes did you take?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The professor asked me whether i have taken his class before and then he asked me some questions related to the class, i gave him the answer which he was very satisfied and he offered me the job after the interview immediately
Interview Questions: why do you want this job

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, Positive , The interviewer were friendly and didn't care about the coding language and stuff. He asked me certain technical questions about my background. He gave me a berlin clock to design and gave me couple of days to code it.
Interview Questions: Asked Resume based questions, Database design questions, Normalization and Denormalization. What was your role in previous company? How you handled this situation? Questions on Database optimization? when can you start working?

title: Information Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall just ask basic computer/networking questions. Know your hardware, your software and your customer service and be a personable candidate. Experience isn't necessary (but a bonus) but being good at talking to people definitely is.
Interview Questions: What is hard-drive defragging and how does it work?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview took 3 weeks. Phone interview first then meeting up with the meeting on Skype. Questions about my background and how will I fit the team. I have to accept to manage the project without supervision as the Principal investigator did not have the time.
Interview Questions: Questions related to the research project of the position.

title: Associate Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 3 person interview process- each PI asks you what your experience is, what lab techniques you have, how many years/publications you have. Overall, its a very relaxing interview process, compared to other industry interviews
Interview Questions: (given a hypothetical experimental question) How would you solve this? What methodologies would you use to figure out this issue?

title: Geocoder Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Easy, not difficult. Friend recommended me. Did research online about the position, accepted a week later for an interview. Interview with boss was easy and relaxed. Looking for hard workers who dont slack. Be prepared for work that is easy and very relaxed. Will not be moving up in a position. consider this to be a temporary position for easy money.
Interview Questions: Typical

title: Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. You simply submit your resume, it gets reviewed, and you are called in for training. Afterwards, you sign up for your first couple of shifts and that's it.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
One of the professor interviewed me and ask me some questions to test my calculus ability. Challenging questions. You should have strong background in mathematics. Also, you need to
show the ability to be a good teacher
Interview Questions: Explain what is Riemann integral

title: Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: This was a very simple interview with the Douglass Campus Supervisor. It was a quick two or three questions to gauge how much you want the job, and if you can speak English in general (this applies to all the international students we have here at RUtgers). It is very basic and you basically can't fail it.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable speaking to large crowds?

title: Engineering Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The main skill required is Auto CAD knowledge. The Employer will ask you to recreate a drawing in Auto CAD. He is strict when it comes to details, however, he does not put you under time pressure, so you can take your time. After you complete the test, he takes a while to respond to you because it is a long process before the HR department allows him to hire you, but eventually he will get back to you.
Interview Questions: Recreate a drawing.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process takes a long time , for Rutgers clearance and DOc clearance then you have to wait to get a physical.There was no one to really follow up to see the progress of your application. The interviewer was very honest about the length of the process, however a company should not take taht long with their process they will loose potential good employees
Interview Questions: What make you think we should hired you

title: Web Editor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, they just asked me about my experince with web and if i knew any coding or had exposure to an CMS. Asked me about what i thought about the site they were working on and how i could help them
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Post Doc Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the PI I was working with, very friendly and professional. Prepared prior to interviewing by reading previous publications of the lab and getting to know the particular work the lab is doing. I got very lucky with my PI, he was very easy-going.
Interview Questions: What are my previous research experience?

title: Help Desk T/Resnet Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. Both were Mostly behavioral and questions asked were mostly to test your communication skills. Questions asked were mostly pertaining to team work, leadership, conflict handling and testing basic technical skills.
Interview Questions: Any conflicts in team? how did you solve it

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was invited by the professor of the group to give a research talk in the group and a private discussion of my work. During the talk, I was grilled hard about my past research, questions designed to throw me out of my game and challenge me, but all went well and I got the job.
Interview Questions: Situate my research in the present state-of-art

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was really nice and helpful during the process. It was fairly short, trading emails then coming in for a quick interview to meet everyone and talk about the kinds of skills I have the projects I've worked on.
Interview Questions: Any experience with CMSes or web development

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process involves two staff members to the research group you are interested in working with. They typically begin by explaining the project that you will be working on and using your resume as the basis to understand if you are a good fit. They want you to explain in detail how your experience will be used for the purpose of the project.
Interview Questions: Explain a project that involved your expertise in GIS?

title: Student Technician At SAS-IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Work Study assigned me to SAS-IT for my job placement, but the job requires an interview to be finalized, since Work Study doesn't have a really good pre-screening process. I dressed business-casual and felt a bit over-dressed, but it's better to be safe than sorry. After the questions were asked, I got the offer on the spot and we discussed the details.
Interview Questions: What are the different types of malware and what do they do? What signs does a computer show that would make you suspect it is infected with malware? What is an operating system and which operating systems do you have experience using? What is an IP address and how is it different than a MAC address? How do you find a computer's IP address and MAC address on Windows? Do you know how to find them on any other operating system? What is the difference between a Mac and a PC? What are the main hardware components of a computer? If you didn't know the answer to a problem you faced on the job, how would you figure it out?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a connection based hire. There was no formal interview. It's very domain specific. I obtained information and agreed to work for them. The hiring process is very length because it's a state government agency.
Interview Questions: Do you wanna work for us?

title: Program Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed and selected for a phone interview. Was told would be informed if went on to in-person interviews soon but received a letter stating that they pursued another candidate.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with one of the supervisors in person. We went over my resume and experiences. They asked me a few technical questions. It was not too difficult. They just wanted to get a feel of who you were.
Interview Questions: How are you with handling people who are tense?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Application with a Statement of purpose,bachelor transcripts, GRE score, TOFEL score, subject GRE score and subject GRE score. It is helpful if you know what area of research you want to work in and additional which professor would you like to work with. Some professors do reply to personalized emails.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It is from Department appointment and most PhD students and some MS students could have a chance to be teaching assistant. It is from Department appointment and most PhD students and some MS students could have a chance to be teaching assistant.
Interview Questions: It is from Department appointment

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: one voicemail and quick return call to ask general details of the job duty.  Few days  before interview, got two more phone calls regarding the salary and the directions to the office.  The interviewer was very nice and answered all my questions.   i was very interested in the  job but i decided to decline due to far commute.
Interview Questions: are you willing to work overtime

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about a half hour.  There was a panel of people interviewing me. The Business Manager and the Director. They took turns asking me questions and explained job requirements of the position. They got back to me after two weeks.
Interview Questions: How much do you know about excel?

title: Business Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was  called in for an interview based on a position that  I had seen listed on line. I met with a Business specialist then a Business Manager
Interview Questions: The questions  were typical. What brought you here?  Why do you want to leave your current position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was quick. I interviewed with two people in the department, my supervisor and her supervisor. After getting to know more about me, my supervisor asked if I had questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was relaxed, had a discussion on my skills. I met with the assistant director of the program. She and I had connected earlier at an information session, where I had a mock-presentation of my teaching abilities. Most other candidates were not required to perform a mock, so maybe that helped me with the process. I earned the job by explaining my communication skill and effective ability to alleviate distress and ambivalence among groups of people.
Interview Questions: How would you manage twenty or so rowdy students?

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Two manager interview
Interview Questions: I feel the interview were not experienced interviewer

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: They want to make sure that you genuinely care about your students and that you are willing to work according to the department's standards. Be articulate and clear about your teaching abilities, and be prepared to discuss your teaching philosophy.
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of the Rutgers-Newark student body?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was quick, introductory, casual and relaxed. We met at the pool, the boss showed me around and showed me how to perform duties. It was more of a formality.
Interview Questions: Have you worked at other pools before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. Interviewer was great asked basic questions like strengths and weaknesses and past experiences. They called me in after a few months of submitting my application
Interview Questions: What is your weakness

title: Plumber Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: hr sucks they take forever cause there always off and sends paper work to you late
Interview Questions: Have you ever thought of leaving your present position before? If yes, what do you think kept you there?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions:
Recruiting is all about 2 events: FIND held at Rutgers, and ASHP Midyear. Succeeding here is all about networking e.g. connecting with fellows to "learn about the program" and preparing for standard interviews. 

Navigating Midyear, or "the gauntlet", is all about preparation. Just practice interviewing until you are comfortable and you will succeed over the amateurs. The most challenging part is the pace and sheer quantity of interviewing, so the best prepared will their loads lighter than those scrambling last minute.
Interview Questions: All interviewers can see every position and company you are applying to, so be prepared to explain your rationale for what kind of positions you applied to

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The Principle investigator invited me to his office the day of the deadline where he had to pick his candidates.  After coming to his office in the pouring rain.  He sat me down, and only asked me one question, which I spent the next 10 minutes answering.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: worked with course professor and had experience with the project, asked for opportunity to work further, got introduced to the team, volunteered first then got paid
Interview Questions: working pace was different, and cooperation sometimes failed

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Took two weeks, interview with a manager
Interview Questions: What would I do in a situation like this....?

title: Head Lifeguards Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: One on One Interview, Skills Check
Interview Questions: How do you feel about team work?

title: Temporary Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with the principal investigator of the lab that was hiring in their office. They went over the research that was being done and asked me about my past experiences. I was required to read a journal article from the lab and discussed what I understood in the interview as well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Master of Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process took 1-2 month to  finally receive the acceptance letter from the Director of the program, the entire process experience was great, got all the questions answered by the Administration office and they did reply email quite fast. The international services office is really helpful in terms of assisting in the process of the immigration documents, and day-to-day Q&A assists.
Interview Questions: Why you want to apply for Master of Financial Analyst

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual and inviting. We all met for a lunch as a group and played ice breakers, then had individual interviews that become more specific. They asked us questions that ranged from creative to technical to see how well we would fit in the team and workplace environment.
Interview Questions: Is it better to be great and late or good and on-time?

title: Mental Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two-step interview process with standard interview questions (background information such as previous employment history as well as educational/academic history). The second interview differed from the first as the questions became more situational and more relevant to the inpatient units (children, adolescents, and adult).
Interview Questions: QUESTION: How would you respond to a patient in crisis (either behavioral or medical)?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed about 5 weeks after application. Panel interview, questions were prepared and the questions did no stray from the sheet everyone had. Make sure you have questions and are able to highlight yourself and your experience that relates to the job.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions including how you handle conflict, goals, and dealing with your supervisor.

title: Teaching Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took over 2 months from time of application to first hearing anything from employer.  Took an additional month to schedule interview.  Starting time was prompt.  Three persons were part of the interview.  False promise of hearing something by end of week or week after.   I emailed them, sent a thank you letter, and kept waiting.  I have received three emails to let me know they are still waiting, but I was their favorite candidate.
Interview Questions: Asking if I understood everything they just spoke about.

title: Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: IT was a fairly easy interview, it was just siple questions an simple stuff that they asked. It talked about school life, how busy I wouuld e etc. Then there was stuff about my background in IT but thy were going to train me anyways so it wasn't that big of a deal. The most important part was the behavior part.
Interview Questions: How long have you gone to this University?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: It is a kind of scholarships. So the hiring process is similar to the recruiting process of graduate school. You submit your CV, personal statement, transcripts (including GRE) etc. The committee members of the department will review your applications. Interview is usually optional. Rutgers does not give interview when recruiting graduate students.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: not much things going on since I graduated from this place and know most of the people working there
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Accounts Specialist - University Hospital Newark Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Not a difficult process, except the time between the initial interview and the time they contact you with an offer can be several weeks/months.  Very slow hiring process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5years type questions.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done over the phone only as I was at the time living abroad. It lasted less than 30 minutes since I had been recommended by mutual collaborators.
Interview Questions: What are you plans after the post doc?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: No interviews. I was required to pass English speak test or RIVA test before I could give a lecture to students.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Candidate-Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: No interview for either position, simple online application submitted
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Part Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: You can find the openings online on the career website. Or sometimes it's by word of mouth or recommendation of an existing employee. They check your technical ability and past teaching experience if any. Having a past teaching experience is a big bonus.
Interview Questions: It can vary from personal to person. I don't recall any such thing.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: A former graduate student called me and we had a friendly chat over my background and research interests. Then he talked about the wok environment at Rutgers.
Interview Questions: I didn't have any

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Small interview  with different county employees. Easy question about oneself . Response was late but because it has to go through the university. But contact was maintained and over all easy Interview
Interview Questions: No real difficult questions

title: Helpdesk Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: Got recommended through a friend, two rounds of interview with assistant director and field support employee. Mainly customer service related some technical questions. Mainly issues related to how do you deal with a difficult customer. Was pretty short maybe 30 minutes maximum and got back to me within a week. Neccesity to have some sort of in because most of the people who get hired get hired through their friends.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple, got talk to the Prof who like to work with and then if he likes you get to work. As soon as you hear from the guy give him an email saying you would like to meet him in person. It may take a while to get a one on one meeting sometimes be patient. Don't go asking for pay and financial support on first meeting. Work with him for sometime if you are satisfied then request him if he can support you.
Interview Questions: be thorough in basics. Don't try to be smart, be realistic

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: academic course work, future plan,you have to introduce yourself and your interest of your research area. tell something about your achievement on  academic work. why you choose teh university. what do you see iin 5 years. your strength and weakness. what have you conquered during your past and how do you deal with it.
Interview Questions: personal statement.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two-day process; on the first day, I had a dinner with a few faculty members in the department I was applying to. On the next day, I had a research presentation (1 and half hours) and several research meetings with each of other faculty members and PhD students.
Interview Questions: What are your main research topics and what is your plan to develop your identity as a scholar?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Questions on past teaching experience. Some personal questions on whether I live on or off campus, if I had a car to make sure that I can get myself to work.
Interview Questions: Any past teaching experience?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: One interview, no technical questions just need to show experience. They look for someone mature and responsible. If you have good experience they won't hesitate to hire you. Overall very easy process and a nice place to work.
Interview Questions: There were none technical questions

title: SAS IT Tech Work-Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Poor, very very basic. 1 stage - face to face interview.
I was invited in to interview with the head of the SAS IT department. 
After finding the office and being invited in, I met with head for a casual interview
A few basic behavioral questions were asked and then I was told that the technical part would start.
To my surprise there was only 1 question and it did not really test whether or not one should be suitable for the job, but I answered it and was asked when I could start. I started the next day.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between a worm and a trojan

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: They tell you what they expect from you and what to do in certain scenarios. Not long, they don't ask any questions like 'tell me about yourself". Listen to what they say because they might ask you a question about what they said before.
Interview Questions: Would you mind getting me a bagel in the morning?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer simply asked about my major and work history and asked why I was majoring in my major. Also asked why I would be a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: What is your major? Why?

title: Graphic Design Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: During the Summer break I received an email about a few job listings on campus. One of them was for a Graphic Design Intern which was exactly what I was looking for. I submitted my resume via email and waited to hear back. About a week later I received a phone call from their office asking for an interview. Close to when school was starting again, I went in with my portfolio in hand and met with the two supervisors for the position. We spoke about the work and looked over my portfolio. They were both so nice. A few days later I got a call that I got the position!
Interview Questions: Do you work well with others?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: No interview process occurred rather they opted to look at your resume and class work.  From there they decide whether or not you are accepted into teaching as a graduate student.  While it seems stressful, it really is not.
Interview Questions: Talk about your dip in grades

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: send the resume through the University hiring webpage, got the email back after 1 week and the PI called back after 2 weeks
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and made it through to first phone interview. Interviewer was director of the Center for Women and Work. We had a 15 to 20 minute conversation going over particular details of the job, and emphasized that the position is grant-funded. Overall, it was normal, casual interview. Interviewer told me that they would notify me on whether or not I'd be going on to next round the week after, but it took them over 2 weeks to respond.
Interview Questions: What was it about this position that made you apply?

title: Temp Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview where super straightforward and relaxed where I worked.  I was asked simply what I knew and what I could offer and if I was comfortable doing the work that I was applying for.  Everyone involved was really friendly and helpful!
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from the other candidates?  How did you hear about this position?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: no interview; I know the person who assign courses in the department, I applied directly with him and then he looked at my portfolio and give me the position. Basically there is no interveiw for this job. I just got it directly
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Rutgers University
Interview Descriptions: An initial phone interview mainly to confirm my qualifications. 45min presentation during an on-site interview. All were very interested.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at Rutgers.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: As a genetics major, I was required to do at least 1 full year of research. I got a list of professors from department page, emailed selected professors and asked for an interview or couple minutes of their time.
Interview Questions: What are your interests? What are your future plans? Ph.D.? Master's? Thesis?

title: Geoscience Scholar Program Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very general because it mainly dealt with reviewing my transcript and the classes I have already taken to determine if I was a good candidate to teach.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in this position and this program?

title: Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Rutgers, NJ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Resume with  proper grammar, a high GPA and a friendly demeanor will get you in the door
Then group interviews - don't bee too agressive - be insightful and helpful. Be a team player
Interview Questions:
Group dynamics - What do you do when a student does not want to participate in study group?
What if you lead a study group and students are texting?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Camden, NJ) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the recruitment website and interviewed in person with the head of the department I was applying for a few days later after they called me in. I started two days after the interview and pretty much actively trained which is something I prefer.
Interview Questions: How much of a work life balance do you think you have?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had worked there part time previously for about 2 years so there was no real interview process.
Interview Questions: It was difficult to answer what were the highs and lows of the position because I never really had any lows while working there.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed on skype and then in person after accepted. Interview over skype was quick, thirty minutes. Full-day interview after accepted. Interview full-day after accepted required lots of meetings, a little overwhelming. But it was good to meet other graduate students during my interview, I got to ask them many questions
Interview Questions: Tell them about myself

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a Skype interview conducted by a faculty member. It was succinct, with very pointed questions, and not many pleasantries. The questions were mostly about reseach interest and intention rather than personality or other facets of one's character.
Interview Questions: Research experience, familiarity with the institute/program, future plans

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic interview. Asked if I had basic proficiency in microsoft excel for data entry purposes.
Interview Questions: Pretty basic interview, no in depth questions.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: They hire you based on experience.  Some problems requires lab skills lab safety animal handling and analysis. Be prepared for them to ask a lot of questions about their field and what you can do
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the professor and it takes only 15 minutes. We meet in his office and asked me if I have any teaching experience. Give me some advises how to deal with problem students. We then talk about the salary.
Interview Questions:
Do you have any teaching experience?
Hypothetical scenario question, what if a student comes to you and claim missing point in grades.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: First we have to apply online or find an adviser. Then, in the case your background was matched with the adviser position you will be asked for an interview. After than I needed to wait by the time they informed me about my approval.
Interview Questions: About the reason I like to continue my education.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Orleans, LA) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: This position is recruited for through ASHP, and involves interviewing with as many as 15-20 pharmaceutical companies. These interviews are done over 3 days and you may get 2nd and 3rd rounds from companies. I personally had approximately 30 interviews with this program over the course of Midyear. After ASHP, on-site interviews are conducted for companies who you are interested in and who you are interested in.
Interview Questions: I was asked what other positions I was interested in and forced to rank them.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions:
It was a day long process including a presentation, dinner and  panel  interview questions, meeting with the Executive Director and dinner.  I started about 10 am and did not conclude until 7pm.
I applied internally and forgot about the opening only to receive a call several months later that I should come in for an interview.  I had to prepare a 20 minute presentation.

I didn't get the position but it allowed me an opportunity to gain visibility within the department which opened the door for future opportunities.
Interview Questions: How would I ensure equitable distribution of services

title: Student Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
There were two interviews. The first interview was with a search committee. Be prepared to discuss your experience working with students, academic advising, and any knowledge of the career process. The search committee is the most difficult. You typically meet with the hiring manager last. Definitely wear professional dress. (ex: suit, button down shirts).

It's also helpful to research the division and campus for which you're applying. The schools each have their own identity and will want to know that you are aware of what makes them different from every other school within the university.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself? Why do you think you are qualified for this position? What is your experience working with diverse student populations? What is your understanding of the majors offered in this division? What are some of your strengths? Weakness?

title: The Rutgers Club Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: They ask you questions about things in your resume and tell you about the job to see if it's for you. The guy was very thorough about what the server position entitled. He made it clear that it was flexible but that he was also looking for responsible people.
Interview Questions: Do you mind cleaning up and picking things up?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Had a total of 3 interviews which went well, very straight forward.
You must have patience though because the process is long, almost 4 months between 1st interview and hire date. Hiring date is not up to department where you will be working, processing after interview goes to HR where it can stall for a while.
Interview Questions: If you're qualified for the position you're applying for then you should have no problems.  They're not out to trick you

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy, You walk in and meet a manger. They let you feel comfortable and as a student they do not put a lot of pressure on you in terms of projects and skill level. They explain you can learn a lot and get many different unique opportunities to learn and relate to your field
Interview Questions: What programming languages do you know

title: Business Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Once I submitted the resume and application, I got called in for an interview. It was relatively basic, going over my experience, how it would apply to the role I was interviewing for, and certain questions about how I would deal with theoretical situations and problems that might come up. All in all, it was a relatively smooth and pleasant experience.
