Interview Questions: How would you deal with a co-worker who was delivering as expected?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Coordinator sat me down, talked to me a bit. Not very insightful. The position I applied for was relatively easy as an intern. However, it seemed as if no one really cared what I did, when I did it by, etc. The interview reflected that. It was very easygoing, casual, nice people. However, still a boring place to be.
Interview Questions: What do you like doing?

title: Administrative Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume online and they called me to came in for an interview.  They seemed disorganized.  My gut feeling was correct.  The interview was very short and brief.  The job was already filled in house but person in charge or the secretary forgot to cancel or tell me.  She was so sorry for wasting my time.  The campus was nice and the facility is very well funded.  The experience was very frustrating since I took a personal day off from work to met with them.  Overall, not a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Rutgers?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I gave a talk on my thesis research and I had one-on-ones with several faculty in the department, as well as a few post-docs. We went to dinner. Pretty standard interview process. They covered travel to and from the interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe my research and some side projects that I worked on.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: One hour phone screen interview with questions about my skills, my background, my previous projects and publications. One day on-site interview (presentation and meeting with team members) that discussed my role in the team, future projects and my career plans.
Interview Questions: Everything about the work and projects and what I could do

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contact by email, discussing about the professor s research projects. No interview, just wait for a month and got the offer. Background match is the key. Strong plus if you have related publication.
Interview Questions: What's your related publications?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Camden, NJ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process involved an initial phone screen, then a 1-1 interview, then an interview with a panel. All interviewers were warm and friendly. I was not intimidated during the interview and found that speaking knowledgeably about what I had to offer helped me make it all three.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience and skills do you bring to the table?

title: Course Ranger Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Speak with Head Professional.  They evaluate your knowledge of golf, personality and ability to communicate.  Overall, it is a conversation about your interests and availability.  Smile and just be yourself.  Everyone here is very friendly.
Interview Questions: Do you play golf?

title: Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application, from which individuals are chosen to have an in-person interview. From this interview, individuals are given a variety of technical and situational questions, and questions about personal background. Employers are looking for strong customer service skills and good tech baseline. Previous work experience will be asked, and tech questions involving applications, networking, and hardware will be asked.
Interview Questions: How would you change the language in Microsoft Word?

title: Community Service Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview in front of 3 men. The Commander, the CSO Battalion Commander, and a representative from the Rutgers police department.
Interview Questions: "What would you do if your partner stole a piece of candy?"

title: Assistant Director of IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by email and setup the interview.   During the interview, I met with 3 individuals and the interview went extremely well. Hiring manager exchanged emails with me about the interview assuring me why I was not a candidate.  It was great feedback.
Interview Questions: Do you have any programming  and development background.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Ask about the past experiences.
Interview Questions: What do you do when something goes wrong in the process?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: I walked into the rec center, asked to speak to the building manager, realized my mistake and asked for the aquatics director, asked the director if they were hiring, asked for an application, filled it out in front of him, asked when we might do an interview, was interviewed on the spot and told to send in my resume as a formality before beginning work the next week.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very informal interview.  Met with Director and one of the Deans of the school.  Had lunch, talked about my personal goals, their goals for the university and that was that.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan on being here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Started as work study. Applied and went in for interview. Then met someone the other individual I would be working for. The process was smooth because I automatically got the position because I was a work study student.
Interview Questions: What are you good at and would bring to the position?

title: Marketing and Communications Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hired as work-study student assistant which allowed me to transition into a part-time summer/fall job and high pay. Interview was in an intimate location directly with the director of the marketing and communications department. Questions were straight-forward and short. He basically just went through my resume step by step, The whole interview lasted about 20 minutes and I was hired at the end.
Interview Questions: How will you be an asset to our team?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Started with a standard resume/cover letter submission, then an in-person interview with several department members. There was discussion about dedication to the role, since they would spend a lot of time training the person.
Interview Questions: There were questions about my knowledge of the department, academics, etc.

title: Group Tutor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up through email. She was nice and just wanted to get a feel for you and why you think you'd be a good tutor. I'm pretty sure the job is yours if you really want it. Be prepared to answer how you would handle some situations (such as what you would do if multiple students come in with questions). Honestly though, you can't go wrong. It's a quick interview with no follow up. It's simple and odds are you'll get the job working the hours that you want.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with multiple students who need to be helped?

title: Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Camden, NJ) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: They just ask you security questions like if there was a fire what would you do? Almost all the questions are like situational questions. Very easy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Teaching Specialist V Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Brief meeting with the principal investigator followed by 3 separate interviews with lab members. They asked mostly about my research skill sets and future plans. They didn't ask any behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What is your GPA?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was blase. but the school is very bureaucratic and corrupt -from graduate students to faculty, it's all about who you know, and that trumps what you know. Also very political. High turnover of non-tenured instructors but tenured ones stay and teach long past the times when they contribute positively and usefully to the university community.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: You have to do online application. After that your application will be reviewed and based on their review they will contact you. You may email their office to know the status of your application any time
Interview Questions: They really want to know what is your interest in different field of chemistry.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Basically we just submitted the application materials then got the offer. The materials include personal statement, CV and possible publication. I wrote about my future career plan and summarized what I did in college in the personal statement.
Interview Questions: No one interviewed us. We submitted the statement of purpose.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process starts from online application. After a couple of weeks, I got notice to interview with the administrator. During the interview, I was firstly asked about what physics courses that I had taken and at what levels (undergrad or grad). Then, a couple of basic concepts about physics were asked. A small demonstration was conducted following the manual they provided.
Interview Questions: How will you help a student to understand that static friction for a walking man is in the same direction that the man is moving?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring process involves contacting a professor based on your interest.
Then work under him for a period of time before actually getting recruited.
Interview Questions: Previous research experience.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contacted by phone for a brief interview by someone at Mason Gross School of the Arts.  After a few days I was contacted again and asked to come in for an in person interview.  The same woman who interviewed me by phone did the in person interview as well.  She asked me a series of fairly difficult questions which sounded like they probably came out of a book on how to conduct interviews.  Not only were the questions tough but required very speculative answers.  After about 1/2 hour I felt like I had been grilled and couldn't wait to get out of there.  When she was done she literally said "I'm done.  I don't have any more questions.  You can go now."   Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel that you are the best person for this job.

title: Academic Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Received a call for an interview, met with the committee for 90 minutes, received an email saying I was overqualified. But, it was a personal email and very nicely done!
Interview Questions: Why have you switched jobs so often during your career?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted with the Principal Investigator (P.I.). I was asked about my reserch experience and if I helped publish any articles on scientific journals.  The interviewer also asked about my future goals--- if I have plans on pursuing a graduate program in Rutgers University. I was also asked if I show my recent college transcripts. Overall, I felt that the interview was long and less intimidating.
Interview Questions: In the future, will you be interested in applying for a graduate program here in Rutgers?

title: Dining Hall Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: There really wasn't an interview. I sent the manager at the time an email with my resume attached, and he sent me one back asking if I was available at certain times during the week, because those were the times he was trying to fill. I said yes, and he told me to come in later in the week, had me fill out the application, and then put me on the schedule ten minutes later.
Interview Questions: Can you work on Wednesday, and the weekends?

title: Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. A couple questions about technical skills. Work study job so guaranteed placement.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and informal experience meeting with a few members.  They clearly outlined the job responsibilities.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the table that another applicant can't?

title: Network Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I was hired from within Rutgers. I first started as an hourly emplyee at the student level. When I was initially hired the manager reached out to me via phone to set up an interview.

The interview process was not long and I was on the job by the next month. This is important to note that this was for an hourly position though. Getting hired for a salaried position is much much slower and moves at a glacial pace. Be prepared for a long and tedious process that could take over 3 months.

Interviews will be with the direct manager you will be reporting to, the associate director and the director. The most technical part of the interview will be with the direct manager. The interviews with the directors will be more personal/attitude interviews.
Interview Questions: If you know the skillset they are asking for there are no really difficult questions. Make sure you know it is a team environment more than anything so be prepared for teamwork questions. For the technical side, CCNA level knowledge will be as in depth as the interview will get.

title: Fitness Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Show up on time, bring a resume.  Don't worry about dressing up; I interviewed in a tshirt and shorts.  Just like with any other job, good grades and impressive involvement/activities will help you win them over.  Emphasize any customer service jobs in the past.  Also, they might ask you where you get your understanding of cardio and lifting and exercise in general; it'll help if you have an identifiable source (anything from Men's Health magazine to an exercise plan from a personal trainer).

After a couple weeks I got an email offering me the position.  TAKE THE JOB.  The pay is literally minimal, but you'll meet great people, learn a lot about fitness, and become a recognizable face on campus.
Interview Questions: What source do you get your knowledge of fitness from?

title: Fitness Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple one on one interview just some basic questions like what is your most proud achievement, etc etc
Interview Questions: What is your most proud accomplishment?

title: Physical Plant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: it was very professional and on topic
Interview Questions: what you would add to the university

title: Technology Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New York, NY) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: They asked me mostly technical questions.
Interview Questions: Did you ever face a problem with your team mate ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Found this job online- posting for a research assistant in a psychology lab.  Great place to work.  Wish I got hired there, but they only hire internally for stimulus projects.  Lots of research.  Bit confusing to get there from northern nj though- roads are often closed, traffic is bad.  Workplace culture seemed to be very collaborative.
Interview Questions: Why didn't you pursue your senior honors thesis as full-time research after graduation?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Piscataway, NJ) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process drags for too long and  I think it depends on which campus you apply for.  If it is a small department they try to fill the position much quicker. Sometimes I can tell that the interviewer already knows who they are going to hire.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question is when they want to know why there are gaps in my resume. Most of the time is because I was laid off or got sick.

title: Senior Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a committee of people.
Interview Questions: What is your vision?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hiring proceeds as at any AAU university.  You send in an application with your CV and statement of teaching and research interests in the fall.  The search committee will wade through hundreds of applications and choose the 10-12 best for phone interviews.  Then the search committee identifies the top 3-4 candidates for in-person interviews.  These are usually 1.5 to 2 day interviews, where you are expected to present at least one seminar.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Rutgers University (Newark, NJ) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: There is a panel interview so its normally 1:3 interview. Standard questions are asked like: why do you want this position, what makes you a good fit, etc. Then more personal questions are asked like: who is your hero and what are your personal aspirations in the company. After that there is a time where you can ask questions and it is imperative that you do so!
Interview Questions: What would you do if.....

title: Part Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: applied online and then i was invited for a phone interview. The person that i talked to on the phone was very nice and he made me feel comfortable. he asked me some questions about my background and resume. A week later i received an email and was asked for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Human Resources Manager  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: While the interview process began quickly, three days after I applied, it did take awhile to complete.  I met with the hiring manager and subsequently met with two others that held the same title. I was asked back to meet the department dean and spent about 30 minutes with her and then spoke again with the hiring manager for another 45 minutes.  There were not a lot of questions asked of me which should have been a red flag.  The hiring manager told me some personal info about others which also should have been a red flag.
Interview Questions: Asked about my previous university experience.

title: Resident Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: After accepted to a graduate school program at Rutgers New Brunswick, I wondered into the Residence Life offices to inquire directly about graduate assistantships. There are group, peer, and director interviews
Interview Questions: When did you have to act as a moderator?

title: Lab Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Rutgers University (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: 2:1 interview.  Questions based on online survey completion.  If you say you are highly skilled they will ask questions accordingly.  Interviewers are professional but easy to relate to and they only make it as hard as you set yourself up for.
Interview Questions: Match the following file extensions to the Appropriate program used to open them: .doc, .xls, .ppt, .pdf
